item.description:
Some objectivists have trouble justifying the giving of gifts, the accepting of the 'unearned'. Yet Rand loved secular Christmas, and only towards the end of her life made it a policy of not accepting gifts. We don't know why her attitude changed, but her writings—especially in Atlas Shrugged—reveal her thoughts towards giving.

David Kelley, an objectivist scholar, calls gifting, "a kind of investment," as well as an egoistic value of benefaction. He views giving as a way to enable the success of someone you love or admire.

Whatever your opinion, please bring your thoughts to our Salon and join us in celebrating the giving season.

When: Sunday, December 21, 11am
Where: White Horse Tavern, 116 Brighton Ave., Allston, MA
Why: Because omelets with candy canes are scrumptious
What: RSVP so we will reserve a spot for you

The food is $10.45/person, but the conversation is free.

Rumor has it Santa will be making the rational sojourn as well.

group.name: The Boston Ayn Rand Meetup Group

item.name: The Rationality of Gift-Giving
